response.original_title: Scenes of TR and his sons Quentin and Archie, 1917-1918 [2]
response.overview: Unrelated segments of Quentin, Archie, and TR at various times and locations. Medium close view of Quentin wearing a WWI uniform standing by a wooden shed in Mineola, New York, May 1917; long shot of Archie in uniform astride a horse possibly in 1917; Archie in uniform, with a cane, standing by a building possibly in 1918; medium shot of TR speaking from the porch at Sagamore Hill; close shot of TR sitting at the 5th Annual International Flower Show in the Grand Central Palace, New York City on March 20, 1917; long shot of crowds and TR in a motorcade probably during 1917, location unknown; TR speaking from a flag-decked platform possibly in 1917; and TR with an unidentified man standing and talking on outside steps of a house, identified by interior title as in Washington, D.C.
response.title: Scenes of TR and his sons Quentin and Archie, 1917-1918 [2]

titles.title: Scenes of Theodore Roosevelt and his sons Quentin and Archie, 1917-1918 [2]
